I would recommend "True Blood" and "White Night". "True Blood" is a TV show that follows the lives of vampires in a fictional city called New Orleans. The show is known for its intense drama, well-developed characters, and engaging plotlines.
On the other hand, "White Night" is a 1973 French film directed by Roman Polanski. The film stars Corbin Bernsen as Dave Lockwood, who wakes up in his own home on a Friday morning after he had a sexual encounter with Jamie Lockwood (played by Joanne Whalley) the previous night.
As Dave is about to leave his house for work, he receives a phone call from his wife Jamie. Jamie tells Dave that she has spent all of her money and credit on her new outfits, shoes, and accessories. Jamie also tells Dave that she has forgotten about paying back her loans and credit cards, which would result in her having to pay more interest and late fees.
As Dave listens to Jamie's rambling about her new outfits, shoes, and accessories, he becomes increasingly frustrated and angry towards Jamie for not being able to keep track of all of her money and credit. As a result, Dave decides that he no longer wants to be married to Jamie, and he plans on filing for divorce from Jamie.
